title: MixEHR-SurG: a joint proportional hazard and guided topic model for inferring mortality-associated topics from electronic health records
abstract: arXiv:2312.13454v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: Existing survival models either do not scale to high dimensional and multi-modal data or are difficult to interpret. In this study, we present a supervised topic model called MixEHR-SurG to simultaneously integrate heterogeneous EHR data and model survival hazard. Our contributions are three-folds: (1) integrating EHR topic inference with Cox proportional hazards likelihood; (2) integrating patient-specific topic hyperparameters using the PheCode concepts such that each topic can be identified with exactly one PheCode-associated phenotype; (3) multi-modal survival topic inference. This leads to a highly interpretable survival topic model that can infer PheCode-specific phenotype topics associated with patient mortality. We evaluated MixEHR-SurG using a simulated dataset and two real-world EHR datasets: the Quebec Congenital Heart Disease (CHD) data consisting of 8,211 subjects with 75,187 outpatient claim records of 1,767 unique ICD

translated_title: MixEHR-SurG：一种联合比例危险和引导主题模型，用于从电子健康记录中推断与死亡相关的主题
translated_abstract: 现有的生存模型要么不适用于高维和多模态数据，要么很难解释。在本研究中，我们提出了一个名为MixEHR-SurG的监督主题模型，可以同时整合异质EHR数据并建模生存风险。我们的贡献有三个方面：(1) 将EHR主题推断与Cox比例风险似然相结合；(2) 使用PheCode概念集成特定于患者的主题超参数，使得每个主题可以被识别为仅与一个PheCode相关的表型；(3) 多模态生存主题推断。这导致了一个高度可解释的生存主题模型，可以推断与患者死亡相关的PheCode特定表型主题。我们使用一个模拟数据集和两个真实世界EHR数据集（魁北克先天性心脏病（CHD）数据和包含8,211名受试者的多个门诊索赔记录的1,767个唯一ICD行为）来评估MixEHR-SurG。
tldr: MixEHR-SurG是一种监督主题模型，结合了EHR数据和生存风险模型，实现了高度可解释的生存主题模型，可以推断与患者死亡相关的PheCode特定表型主题。
en_tdlr: MixEHR-SurG is a supervised topic model that integrates EHR data and survival hazard modeling to achieve a highly interpretable survival topic model, which can infer PheCode-specific phenotype topics associated with patient mortality.
